For 8 to 9 Euros, I was able to get an awesome lunch special!  The lunch special comes with salad, soda, and coffee or tea afterwards.  Your main selection can be a sandwich or 2 empanadas, or a burger.  I do believe that the burger comes with fries instead of salad though.  How can you beat that deal?!  I like a great deal but the truly impressive part was that the service was delightful and the food was delicious.  I selected the Spanish ham with brie focaccia that came out perfectly toasted.  Slight crunch to the bread without it being too hard and the brie perfectly melted.  The salad was a mix of baby greens tossed with cheese crumbles, grape tomatoes, oranges, and light vinaigrette.  At the end of the meal, they came by to take our coffee or tea order.  I had the cafe con leche which ended my meal at a beautiful note.  We definitely had a leisurely lunch and like most European restaurants, they do not rush you out.  When you are ready, ask for the check.  (Note: American Express is not accepted here)P.S. - The place was packed when we arrived around 2 pm, so they asked if we would share a large table with other parties and we did.  By 3 pm the place was pretty much emptying out.
